newsitem.title: UK: McKechnie gains after upbeat statement.
newsitem.headline: McKechnie gains after upbeat statement.

text.p: Shares in McKechnie Plc nudged higher in early trading on Tuesday after the plastics and components group posted a rise in profits and said it had seen signs of an economic upturn since the start of the current year.
The stock was up 4p at 532-1/2 by 0710 GMT -- near the record 543p set September 16.
In a statement, McKechnie chairman Vanni Treves said: "Since the start of the new financial year we have seen indications that the long-awaited economic upturn may be on the way.
"In the UK destocking appears to have abated and order books are up even in the highertoo depressed housing-related sector."
Analysts said the 11 percent rise in pre-tax profit to 50.3 million stg had been foreshadowed in McKechnie's rights issue last month and it was the positive statement that boosted the stock.
"The figures were no surprise but the statement was quite encouraging," said one.
Prospects in the U.S. were improving and the market in Europe had stabilised, Treves said. He was confident the current year would be one of "significant progress" for the company.

By 0900 GMT McKechnie shares were up 12p at 540-1/2 and there were scattered gains across the engineering sector, with Senior Engineering Plc up 5-1/2p at 111, Morgan Crucible Plc up 8p at 470 and Siebe Plc up 3p at 973-1/2.
